fields.description:
After migrating from JIRA 4.2 to JIRA 5.0.3, email is not sent to the reporter even though reporter has been added in the notification scheme.  E.g. when issues are created or when comments are added, Current Assignee, Reporter and All Watchers in the notification list.

- When issue is created, only Current Assignee is sent a notification email
- When the Current Assignee added a comment, Current Assignee and Reporter do not receive any email
- When Reporter added a comment, only Current Assignee is sent a notification email

After setting all the notification scheme to default, the problem still occurs.
fields.summary: Notification Bug after Migration from JIRA 4.2 to JIRA 5.0.3
Please update Applications Links Versions Matrix to include compatibility between versions
Update Import from CSV Documentation

fields.description: In the case where there are no workflow schemes, the space below the info message box is double what it is meant to be.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28223].
  {panel}

The Share feature added in JIRA 5.0 has the potential to be quite valuable, but as they are today, all they do is save a copy-and-paste operation.

The biggest gap is in using the Share feature on the Issue Navigator.  This could be very useful if it e-mailed the list of issues, in the same way that a filter subscription already does.  As it stands, the Share feature only sends a link to the issue...but there's already the long-standing "permalink" button just to the left of Share that gives me that URL already.  So, as it exists today, the Share button only saves me pasting the permalink into an e-mail, and provides almost no additional value.

When Sharing an individual issue, most of what I've said above is true (in that case, I don't even need to click permalink, I can just use the issue's URL), but the e-mail has a little more relevant data, especially in the Text version.

Note that knowing the velocity templates used by these functions (i.e. which could be customized for a JIRA instance) would be an acceptable workaround for this problem (provided the velocity template for Sharing filter results could be modified to include the results themselves).
fields.summary: Please make Share e-mails more informative

fields.description: When I go to Project, View All Projects, we do not see the Reports link on the right.  We have timetracking enabled...
fields.summary: Report link not visible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28221].
  {panel}

Hello developer and support-team,

we need a separated permission in "Permission Scheme" for version and component administration.

At the moment I can only grant "Administer Projects". But a user with this rights can modify Project-Role-Membership. This is not my goal.

Possibly it's easyer to separat a Project-Role-Membership-administration to a new permission.

I hope this idea was accepted, because we need this subdivision.

Best regards
lolo
fields.summary: separated permissions in "Permission Scheme" for version and component administration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28220].
  {panel}

I'm using the rest API in a kind of synchronisation project.
As a part of this project, it would be very useful after an update, to be able to retrieve the corresponding changelog id.

For instance:
  - I update the description on issue A
  - in the answer, i'll have the corresponding work-log id

Or maybe there is already a way to accomplish this ?
fields.summary: Being able to retrieve the changelog id of an action on an issue  after an update  (via REST API).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28219].
  {panel}

Basically, we want to prevent people from managing versions, since these are standards across a big set of projects (~400) and created automatically. This right should be reserve to system administrators.
However other parts of project administration (e.g. components) are not standardized and should remain freely editable for users with project administration rights.

So we'd like to see some more granular project admin rights, where we can restrict version management rights to system admins without preventing project admins to do other project administration tasks.

See this [question|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/53962/how-can-i-disable-the-manage-versions-link-at-the-right-by-developing-a-plugin-or-some-other-way] for more details.
fields.summary: Provide more granular project administration rights

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28218].
  {panel}

It is difficult to understand how to save a filter after editing it. 
Please, see the steps to reproduce:

0. Go to a Project
1. Select _Issues > Manage_ Filters
2. Create and save a filter "*TestFilter*"
3. Select Edit in 'gear' icon drop down (in order to edit "TestFilter").
4. Select Edit link from near upper-left corner (in order to edit
the filter criteria).
5. Modify anything about the filter query details.

* It would be good to have a *save* button here.

6. You have to press the *search* button.
7. It'll appear the "Filter modified since loading" message.
8. Now, you'll need to go to the *Summary* tab.
9. And, under *Operations* click on *Save changes to filter*.
fields.summary: Better way to modify a saved filter

fields.description:
https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Web+Resource+Plugin+Module documents web resource contexts.  In particular, it documents Jira-specific contexts.  One of the web resource contexts listed on that page is "jira.issue.create", described as "[t]he create issue page in JIRA" and "only available in JIRA 4.4 and later".

However, if you actually try to design a plugin that includes, say, a Javascript file on the create issue page in Jira, and you try using the "jira.issue.create", your Javascript file will never appear.  The create issue page won't load it.

Now, if you actually look at the Jira source, you find a reference to a "jira.create.issue" context.  And then, if you change your plugin to use the "jira.create.issue" context instead of the "jira.issue.create" context, your Javascript file does get loaded on the create issue page.

The obvious conclusion is that https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Web+Resource+Plugin+Module is wrong, and "jira.issue.create" on that page should be replaced with "jira.create.issue".
fields.summary: Developer documentation lists "jira.issue.create" as a web context, but it should be "jira.create.issue"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28208].
  {panel}

The current documentation on [creating a notification scheme|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme] is incorrect in stating the following:
{quote}
JIRA is pre-packaged with a notification scheme called Default Notification Scheme which, by default, is associated with all newly-created projects. 
{quote}

The way that JIRA works is that the user has to:
* Create the project eg: "test"
* Go to admin > Click on Projects > "test"
* Scroll to Notifications > Scheme > None
* Actions > Select a Scheme
* Scheme > Default Notification Scheme > Associate

This is the case for 4.4.x and 5.0.x as far as it has been tested.
fields.summary: Creating a Notification Scheme Doc - Default notification scheme is not automatically associated as written

Certain Project Key Pattern can alter how the comment is displayed.  

Steps to replicate:
# Change the project key to ([A-Z]([A-Z]+|[2]))
# Create a project (For this example, the project key is TST)
# Comment on any issue, and the comment should contain the issue key number
** For example, make a comment with _TST-1_
# The above steps will alter the comment to _TSTST-1_

As an example:
* A user write _TST-1_ as a comment
!tst.png!
* When submitting or previewing the comment, the comment will be altered
!tstt.png!

  {panel}

I would like to configure custom fields as mandatory only on special occasions, e. g. workflow status etc. 

E. g. need a specific information (custom field dropbox), when status is resolved?

see     JIRA Support     JSP-125707


Shapla Khanam [Atlassian] added a comment - 08/May/12 2:05 AM

Hi Monika,

Thanks for contacting Atlassian Support, pleased to meet you .

    Is it possible to configure JIRA, that fields are mandatory, when status values are different?
    E. g. need a specific information (custom field dropbox), when status is resolved?

Unfortunately, this is not possible in JIRA at the moment. However, if you would like to see this feature implemented in a future version of JIRA please submit a feature request at:

http://jira.atlassian.com

For more information on how Atlassian implements new features and improvement please see the following document:

    Implementation of New Features and Improvements

We will track it as an improvement request. Please let us know if you require any further assistance.

Cheers,
Shapla
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Mandatory Field only on specific status values

fields.description:
Hi everyone,

I'm sorry that I have to raise just another issue. I had posted a question on Atlassian answers but it's not being addressed : https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/48199/accepted-translations-don-t-apply-gibberish-can-t-be-the-solution

Thats why I'll post this here as well:

there's a problem we are facing which really is a pain in the ... - translations, in our case German translations. New features aren't translated by Atlassian when they ship their products (e.g. issue links to Confluence pages /"is mentioned in"), OK...I have come to understand that translations are being maintained by a community (I do contribute myself...). I regularly check on updates and upload them via the UPM. Now the question: Why do certain translations not get reflected in the system. As an example I'd like to point out the descriptions on the project administration page. In the screenshot attached you can see that the descriptions are all in English while the headings are being translated. Many translations of the descriptions have been accepted almost A YEAR AGO but won't apply. Am I missing something here? Issues have been raised and marked as solved but the problem isn't solved for me. It really is kind of embarrasing showing people and potential customers JIRA features and always having to point out that the translations are being adressed half hartedly...I could certainly live with that since I prefer the English interface, many of our customers don't.

You'll find those problems everywhere: Activity stream, administration pages, project administration pages, workflow designer....

I really like your products but you should focus on your customer needs. Germany is a large customer base and people are getting pissed off...
fields.summary: German translations don't apply

The same problem affects any portlet configured with a filter, ie. 'Average Age Chart', 'Created vs Resolved Chart', 'Heat Map', 'Issue Statistics', 'Recently Created', 'Resolution Time', '2D filter statistics' and others.

In firebug I see the Javascript error, 'window.top.JIRA is undefined'.

Gadgets from JIRA 4.4.5 work correctly:

!jira445_filterresults.png!

Fortunately already-configured gadgets still work. It's only inserting new or editing existing gadgets that breaks.

fields.description:
If multiple sessions visit the import progress monitor page, only one will see the outcome of the import.

For example, if we have 2 sessions polling the status like this:
!Selection_173.png|thumbnail!

One session sees the successful outcome, but the second sees only an error claiming no import was initiated:
!Selection_174.png|thumbnail!

Consequently, an admin may fail to receive a success message or meaningful error message, and instead see only "No previous import result was found, doesn't look like your were running an import".

The cause is that the result of the import is stored in the first session to go through {{JiraImportProgressFilter}}, then is discarded. Perhaps the last import result could be stored in memory-backed {{PropertySet}} or similar.
fields.summary: If multiple sessions visit the progress monitor page during an import, only one will see the outcome of the import when it completes.

fields.description:
The Bug shows that cookies for search navigator only support latest search tab, interaction with the tabs can mix what is being viewed in the filters.

To reproduce:

1: create two search filters:

{code}
# JIRA

project = JIRA

# GreenHopper 

project = greenhopper
{code}

2: Now open each search filter in its on tab.

3: Now full reload JIRA tab.  Now full reload GreenHopper tab.

4: Go back to JIRA tab, and click Edit to edit the JIRA search filter.

5: You will be shown the GreenHopper edit filter screen

This is not browser specific and seems to have to do with the cookie on the JIRA server.
fields.summary: JIRA cookies for search navigator only support latest search tab

fields.description: I'm trying to assign a ticket to a user. When I click on the arrow to expand the drop down list, only users under the "Suggestion" list show up. The rest of the users don't.
fields.summary: Assign issue screen only shows "Suggestions" in the list

fields.description:
When looking at the project landing page, the Issue Statistics displayed the wrong number of tickets as 'unassigned'. Upon much deeper review, we discovered that the gadget was using the following logic:
# Scan list of tickets for usernames
## foreach that matches, count number of tickets for user, display as count for user
## for first username that does not match user table, count all tickets with that username and display as count for unassigned
# Disregard all other tickets


The issue here is that it will not actually ever count the unassigned tickets if there is at least one deleted user. This gadget ought to assume that ticket is unassigned iff assignee = NULL.
fields.summary: Missing user borks Assignee filter; Issue Statistics gadget

fields.description:
Hi all,

As per our documentation [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme#CreatingaNotificationScheme-Associatinganotificationschemewithaproject], a user with Project Administrator permission can edit the Notification Scheme for the project. But this does not happen if the user does not belong to the jira-administrators group.

+Steps to reproduce+ :
# Create a user with membership "jira-users"
# Add the role "Administrator"  to the user. 
# Add "Administrator" role to the "Administer Project" permission.

This would make this user an Administrator for the project.

Now, go to the Project->Notification click More. You will not see the Actions gear box on the screen.
!Screen shot 2012-05-08 at 3.45.19 PM.png!

This is reproducible with most versions of Jira. So I believe there is something wrong with the documentation and it needs to be updated.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: User with Project Administrator permission not able to change Notification scheme.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28182].
  {panel}

With the "Include sub-tasks" is checked, better show 4 figures (for the grid) or corresponding bars (for the parent task screen):
   * estimated time of parent task (like in unchecked mode)
   * sum of estimated times for sub-tasks (new)
   * estimated remaining time 
   * logged time (as it is, the sum of all logged time for sub and parent task)
fields.summary: Improvement in the Time Tracking section

fields.description: If I want to add comments from email using Outlook, it will create a multiple body parts. JIRA cannot accept an email which has multiple body parts, therefore, comments will not be added to the issue. Problem is not reproducible using other mail client such as Thunderbird.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Open Firefox
# Options > Privacy
# Under the *History* section and _Firefox will:_ area, select *Use Custom Settings For History*
# Under the _Keep Until_ field, change the value to *ask me every time*.
# Click OK to save settings.
!Firefox Preferences_004.png!
|
# Browse to your instance, and allow cookies manually:
!Confirm setting cookie_005.png!
|
# Once the instance's dashboard is shown, click on *Can't access your account?* link:
!Selection_006.png!
|
# On the next screen, the text box to fill in any details are not rendering at all:
!Selection_007.png!

Lowering the security and accepting cookies until they expire would fix this, but it would be nice if the fallback was done nicely and appropriately.
fields.summary: Restricting the Cookie Acceptance in Firefox would Cause Text Fields to Not Render

fields.description:
For the OnDemand instances the GMT offset for Moscow is not correct.
The correct value should be GMT +4 while OnDemand shows GMT +3

Verified with a local installation of Jira, there the GMT offset is correct.
See screenshots for additional information.
fields.summary: Moscow GMT offset not correct in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28175].
  {panel}

When importing users into JIM from .csv files there is a use case for giving users the option to do something of the following:
* Import all those users, and put them into the jira-users group for example
* Import all those users, but have them as users who are not in any groups (not active and will not count towards the license count)
* Do not import users
fields.summary: JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM) to give the option to import users or not

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28173].
  {panel}

It seems that JIRA users who do not have permission to access Confluence can still see the status updates of Confluence users.  

Steps to replicate (per-requisite: Set up JIRA and Confluence application link):
# Set up Confluence to use JIRA user base
# Create a user that does not have access to Confluence.  In other words, users can only access JIRA.  For example JIRAuser
# A user in Confluence [updates his/her status|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF34/Viewing+Status+Updates]
# Login to JIRA as a user who does not have permission to Confluence.  This user is still able to see the status updates of Confluence Users from JIRA Activity Stream.
fields.summary: Users who do not have permission to access Confluence are able to see Confluence's status update on JIRA Activity Stream

fields.description:
Several REST web services are vulnerable to [XSRF|https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-Site_Request_Forgery_(CSRF)], allowing malicious web pages to execute them under the context of a logged in users browser. 

It's understood that JIRA REST interfaces are typically protected against XSRF based on the content-type they consume. The following methods are vulnerable as they consume content types that can be submitted by a standard HTML form:
* MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN
* MediaType.MULTIPART_FORM_DATA
* MediaType.APPLICATION_FORM_URLENCODED
* MediaType.WILDCARD

The severity of these vulnerabilities vary from adding voters/voting on issues, to updating project and user avatars.

||Filename||Methods||
|FavouriteResource.java| * Undo|
|IssueResource.java| * addVoter 
* addWatcher|
|JiraInlineActionResource.java| * watchIssue
* voteIssue|
|MessageHandlersResource.java| * validate
* testHandler|
|ProjectAvatarResource.java| * updateUserAvatar|
|ProjectCategoriesResource.java| * setCurrent|
|ProjectResource.java| * storeTemporaryAvatar
* storeTemporaryAvatarUsingMultiPart|
|RenderersResource.java| * getRenderedContent|
|UserResource.java| * updateUserAvatar
* createAvatarFromTermporary
* storeTemporaryAvatar
* storeTemporaryAvatarUsingMultiPart|
|ValidationResource.java| * validateProject|
fields.summary: Several REST interfaces vulnerable to XSRF

I was trying to set up a script listener that would fire an email if an issue was moved into critical priority. 

I used the following email template in the preview, and it worked fine:

----------------------
Dear <% out << issue.assignee?.fullName %>,
 
The $issue.issueType.name $issue.key with priority <% out << issue.priority?.name %> has been assigned to you.
 
Description: ${issue.description}
 
Regards,
<% out << issue.reporter?.fullName %>

fields.description:
Reproduction sequence:
1. Open any issue (for example, on JAC)
2. Hit "." to open an operations dialog
3. Hit Escape
4. Try to expand or collapse any section on the page

Observed: nothing happens
Expected: works as usual

Investigation:

You have a typo in initToggleBlock.js, the passed option {{ctx}} should in fact be {{$ctx}}. This causes the toggle handlers to initialize once more with the default context ({{document}}), and as a result, the toggling happens twice when you click the trigger.

fields.description:
When a field uses the plain-text renderer, or part of a field is inside a \{noformat\} block, we should not parse that text for mentions.

Reasons:
* I don't think it's right to have a field type that has historically been pure, plain text; to now respond to one single markup tag in one specific way.
* In cases where plain-text has been explicitly enabled (that is, in behind-the-firewall instances, or where \{noformat\} is used), it's because the admin specifically wants that value to be treated as plain-text - e.g. stack traces or logs. If we no longer respect that, eventually we'll get customers asking for a plain-plain text field.
* Plain-text is also used for performance reasons that may be impacted by this. If large amounts of text are accidentally inserted into a wiki-rendered JIRA field, the issue becomes unviewable and uneditable. In these cases, Support switches the field renderer to plain-text to fix it up. According to Studio support, this happens roughly once a month on hosted. We need to be sure that Mentions' addition of rendering to this field type does not impact this use case. 
* The current behaviour is not that great - if you mention someone in a plain-text field, you get the raw \[~pwyatt\] markup appearing on the View Issue screen (which means nothing to end-users on a plain-text system) and the whole field is rendered as wiki markup in the Mentions email (which is incorrect).
* In Confluence, text inside \{code\} blocks is not parsed for Mentions.

That said, disabling Mentions in plain-text mode would essentially turn off this feature for most OnDemand customers, where the default comment/description renderer is plain-text. Obviously that's not desirable.
Some solutions:
* In the Mentions advertising, link to the instructions for enabling wiki markup. 
* Send it out dark in 5.0 OnDemand for plain-text customers, and in the next OnDemand release, add a one-click feature for admins to convert all their comment/description fields to wiki renderer. This would get around the pain that is the Field Configuration administration pages.
fields.summary: Mentions does not respect plain-text renderer or {noformat} blocks

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Open quick create and ensure the Time Tracking field is shown
2. Create an issue and check the box to create another
3. Submit the form
4. Notice that it now only shows Original Estimate

Talked to Andreas and agree with him that we shouldn't copy the values across to the new fields when creating another.

h4. Workaround:

Click on _*Configure Fields*_ options and select *Custom* then select *All* again.

This workaround needs to be applied every time you create another issue.

*Note*: the Remaining Estimate value will not be saved if filled previously like the Original Estimate field value.
